title: Longhorns QB Arch Manning is in the running for Manning Award
description: Arch Maning earns national praise for his play and could win a very special award with ties to the Texas Longhorns QB's family.
fullText:
Following his first full season as the Longhorns' starting quarterback, Arch Manning is earning national attention for his play. On Thursday, the Louisiana native was one of five players added as a finalist for the Manning Award. In total, there are 15 finalists for the honor.

During the 2025 campaign, Manning completed 248-of-404 passes for 3,163 yards. While completing 61 percent of his passing attempts, the Longhorns' star found the end zone 26 times and etched his way into the record books. He had three games with at least 300 passing yards and three touchdown passes without an interception, the most by a Longhorns QB since Major Applewhite in 1999.

Manning Award Finalist - @ArchManning ü§ò pic.twitter.com/zePcnfmWTY

‚Äî Texas Football (@TexasFootball) January 8, 2026

While the Isidore Newman High Alum made headlines with his arm, he was also a threat on the ground. The Longhorns ' sophomore recorded 399 rushing yards on 92 carries. That was the second-most on the team, trailing only¬†Quintrevion Wisner, who is now a Seminole. Regardless of the opponent, Manning found a way to make an impact.

Although Manning had an up-and-down start, he got better as the season went on. When he was locked in Texas was hard to stop and held their own against ranked teams. While the Longhorns did not qualify for the College Football Playoff, they did finish with 10 wins and beat Michigan in the Cheez-It Citrus Bowl.

Arch Manning outrunning the entire defense for 60 yards 
He was absolutely rolling pic.twitter.com/rhhOKpsgSa

‚Äî Bengal (@BengalYouTube) December 31, 2025

As Manning begins preparing for his junior campaign, he will be watching how the voting for the award named after his uncles plays out. While it is a crowded field, the former five-star recruit made a compelling case with his play as the season winded down. The winner will be revealed on January 19th, after the College Football Playoff National Championship.

This article originally appeared on Longhorns Wire: Texas Football QB Arch Manning named finalist for Manning Award

title: Michigan football star RB Justice Haynes to enter transfer portal
description: Michigan football's star running back from 2025, Justice Haynes, is on his way out of Ann Arbor as he will enter the transfer portal.
fullText:
Michigan football's star running back from 2025, Justice Haynes, is on his way out of Ann Arbor.

Haynes announced he was entering the transfer portal on social media on Friday, Jan. 9. Haynes ran 121 times for 857 yards (7.1 yards per carry) and 10 touchdowns across seven games before he was lost for the season due to injury against Michigan State in the final game of October.

Haynes, who also caught 13 passes for 50 yards, broke his foot late against MSU which required surgery the following week. He had a boot on his foot and rode a scooter for much of the next month and could not return before the end of the season. He was on the sideline for U-M's Cheez-It Citrus Bowl loss to Texas, but did not dress.

"I want to express my gratitude to the University of Michigan," Haynes' post began. "This place has shaped me in ways that go far beyond football. ... Representing Michigan and embracing what it means to be a Michigan Man is something I'll always be proud of.

"After reflection, prayer and heartfelt conversations with my family, I've made the decision to close my chapter at the University of Michigan. I plan to return for another year of college football and enter the transfer portal."

MORE PORTAL NEWS: Michigan football loses multiple defensive back starters to the portal

Haynes, who spent just one season in Ann Arbor, was a true gamebreaker. He was tied for third in the nation with four rushes of 50 yards or more, which included two touchdown runs of more than 70 yards. The only thing that seemingly could stop Haynes this year was his own injuries. He also went down in the first half of a game against USC with an injury to his midsection and missed the following week against Washington.

In the six games he was able to play at least one half, Haynes had more than 100 rushing yards and at least one touchdown. While this is a big blow to U-M's backfield, it was somewhat expected. Jordan Marshall, who was another star for the Wolverines in Tony Alford's room, had already made his announcement he was going to return to Ann Arbor in 2026.

On top of that, the Wolverines bring in Savion Hiter, the No. 1 running back in the nation in the class of 2026. Also, on Thursday, Jan. 8, the Wolverines signed Taylor Tatum, the former No. 1 running back in the nation in the class of 2024, from Oklahoma.

"To the Michigan fans and the Ann Arbor community, thank you for embracing me with open arms and cheering me on," Haynes said. "To my brothers in the locker room, I'll forever cherish the bond we share and the memories we made on and off the field.

"Michigan will always be a special part of my story. I'm deeply thankful for everything this chapter has given me."

Tony Garcia¬†is the¬†Wolverines¬†beat writer for the Detroit Free Press. Email him at apgarcia@freepress.com and follow him on X at¬†@RealTonyGarcia.

This article originally appeared on Detroit Free Press: Michigan football star RB Justice Haynes to enter transfer portal

title: Former Colorado quarterback drawing interest from Ohio State, Kentucky
description: Former Colorado QB Ryan Staub is gaining momentum with visits scheduled to two SEC programs and a Big 12 school as he searches for a starting role.
fullText:
Former Colorado Buffaloes backup quarterback Ryan Staub is quickly becoming one of the more intriguing names in the transfer portal, with visits lined up with Ohio State, Kentucky and Cincinnati in the coming days.

The trio of stops highlights the level of interest Staub has generated among programs looking to add depth, competition and experience to their quarterback rooms.

Staub served as a reserve at Colorado under head coach Deion Sanders, backing up Shedeur Sanders, Kaidon Salter and Julian Lewis over his three seasons in Boulder.

Now in the portal and reportedly looking to start, Staub is drawing interest from three very different programs. Ohio State offers a chance to develop in one of college football's best programs and perhaps challenge five-star freshman Tavien St. Clair to be Julian Sayin's backup. However, the Buckeyes do not appear to be the best fit if Staub wants to start. Kentucky is another SEC program, but with the Wildcats adding Notre Dame's Kenny Minchey in the transfer portal, Staub would likely be a backup once again.

Ryan Staub has visits lined up to Ohio State, Kentucky and Cincinnati in the upcoming days, he tells ESPN. https://t.co/yW5j1yaHW5

‚Äî Pete Thamel (@PeteThamel) January 8, 2026

Cincinnati, on the other hand, gives Staub the best chance to become a starter after star quarterback Brendan Sorsby moved to Texas Tech this offseason. With the Bearcats also bringing in Georgia Southern transfer JC French IV, Staub and French would compete for the starting job in the spring.

All of Buff Nation should be excited to see Staub getting attention from multiple top programs as he continues his quest for regular playing time.

Follow Charlie Strella¬†on¬†X,¬†Threads¬†and¬†Instagram.

Contact/Follow us¬†@BuffaloesWire¬†on X (formerly Twitter) and like our page on¬†Facebook¬†for ongoing coverage of¬†Colorado¬†news, notes and opinions.

title: Dana White picks UFC‚Äôs greatest rivalry ever ‚Äì and it‚Äôs not Khabib vs McGregor
description: Dana White has weighed in on the most intense rivalry the sport has ever seen. As UFC CEO, he has been ringside for countless personal clashes over the years.
fullText:
Dana White has weighed in on the most intense rivalry the sport has ever seen.

As UFC CEO, he has been ringside for countless personal clashes over the years.

Khabib Nurmagomedov vs Conor McGregor is easily the most high-profile feud to come out of the organisation.

From a bus attack and arrests to an all-out melee following their fight at UFC 229, it was about as chaotic as it gets.

But according to Dana White, there is another pairing that topped even them.

In January 2015, Jones got the better of ‚ÄòDC‚Äô over five rounds at UFC 182.

Two years later, their rematch saw Jones land a KO, but that result was later overturned after he tested positive for turinabol metabolite.

Their feud also featured a press conference brawl that is still fresh in White‚Äôs memory over a decade later.

When asked to name the greatest rivalry he has been a part of, the UFC boss replied: ‚ÄúIt would absolutely be those two.

‚ÄúThey fist fought in the lobby of the MGM. Yeah, [Dave] Sholler blew that one.

‚ÄúThe hardest thing is, when you‚Äôre there, you are not there for a photo op. You are there to make sure these guys don‚Äôt touch or disrespect each other. Once somebody feels disrespected, they‚Äôve gotta get theirs in.

‚ÄúI don‚Äôt care who you the f‚Äî you are, you are not stopping s‚Äî once some of these guys decide to go.‚Äù

The long-standing feud between Jones and Cormier has resurfaced, this time over a Russian reality TV show.

Cormier said the two had verbally agreed to a trilogy fight during one of their heated exchanges on set, though it would take place under wrestling or boxing rules rather than MMA.

Despite efforts from Jones to bury the hatchet, he is now convinced that there is no going back between them. Speaking on Thursday, he did not hold back his thoughts on ‚ÄòDC‚Äô.

‚ÄúWhat a stuffy, just d‚Äîhead Cormier really is. I think if you really get to know Daniel Cormier, he‚Äôs really not (a nice person), he‚Äôs an a‚Äìhole, he really is an a‚Äìhole.

‚ÄúHe didn‚Äôt really connect with any of the fighters here, he‚Äôs just an a‚Äìhole. I tried to make peace with him many times, and he made it very clear that he wants to be enemies for life because of how lucrative it is, and he‚Äôs just ‚Äì I don‚Äôt know.

‚ÄúThere was moments where we got to laugh, but for the most part, he‚Äôs a d‚Äîhead.‚Äù

title: Why is Oregon in the Big Ten?
description: Oregon will face Indiana in a Big Ten rematch and we go over why the Ducks are in the league in the first place.
fullText:
The College Football Playoff semifinals will feature the most anticipated rematch of the entire year on Friday as the No. 5 Oregon Ducks will square off with the No. 1 Indiana Hoosiers in the Peach Bowl.

The two teams previously met in a tight top-10 clash back on October 11, one that saw the Hoosiers go into Eugene and leave with a 30-20 victory. This proved to be the most consequential result in the Big Ten this year as it helped propel IU to a matchup with fellow unbeaten Ohio State in the conference championship game while also costing Oregon a shot at successfully defending its Big Ten title.

Some of you may not be in tune with all of the conference realignment moves that have taken place in college athletics over the past few years and may be wondering ‚Äúwait, why Oregon is in the Big Ten? That seems weird.‚Äù And you are correct, it is weird! The Ducks now call what has historically been a Midwestern league home because the old Pac-12 fell apart.

To summarize how this came to be, this decade‚Äôs round of realignment kicked off with Oklahoma and Texas jumping in tandem to the SEC, a massive move that strengthened the already powerful southern-based league. The massive boost in revenue and prestige for the SEC put pressure on other power conferences to keep up, especially a Pac-12 that had dragged its feet on securing an adequate media rights deal through two commissioners. Trying to ensure their own futures, USC and UCLA sent shockwaves through the college sports landscape in the summer of 2022 with the announcement of them joining the Big 10, destabilizing the West Coast league they were leaving behind.

Without the Los Angeles schools, Pac-12 commissioner George Kliavkoff continued to struggle to secure the conference a new media rights deal and those efforts were further complicated when the Big 12 was able to extend its agreement with FOX and ESPN in June of 2023. He was finally able to present a deal with Apple to league members that August, an underwhelming offer that prompted several schools to start looking for the exits. What resulted was the floodgates being opened as Oregon and Washington left for the Big Ten, the quartet of Arizona, Arizona State, Colorado, and Utah departed for the Big 12, and the California Bay Area duo of Cal and Stanford ended up in the ACC. Oregon State and Washington State were left behind in the wreckage and has since assembled a new Pac-12 that is set to go live next season.

So yeah, that‚Äôs why Oregon is in the Big Ten and playing October games against the likes of Indiana and Wisconsin instead of Arizona and Cal. It‚Äôs a true shame that the premier West Coast conference as we knew it no longer exists, but that‚Äôs just the nature of college athletics these days.

title: PGA Tour makes Farmers exit from Torrey Pines official. What comes next?
description: The PGA Tour said Friday that Farmers Insurance would no longer sponsor the event at Torrey Pines after an eventful 17-year run
fullText:
In the winter of 2010, the PGA Tour‚Äôs long-standing tournament in San Diego faced an existential crisis. Person fortunes had been lost and businesses were still reeling from the world‚Äôs financial crisis that began only 15 months earlier, and among the companies filing for bankruptcy was auto giant General Motors. GM funded the Buick Invitational at Torrey Pines for 18 years and hauled in a sponsor's bounty: six victories by Tiger Woods. But after filing for bankruptcy, GM pulled its support one year before the end of the contract and left the Century Club of San Diego scrambling for a new title at a time in corporate America when few CEOs wanted to be seen supporting perceived vanity projects.

That tournament in 2010 was set to simply be called the ‚ÄúSan Diego Open‚Äù for the first time in five decades. Hats and tickets and banners were made with a simplistic logo that reflected the spartan times.

Then a Martin Luther King Jr. Day miracle happened. On the holiday Monday, Jan. 18‚Äî10 days before the tournament was to begin‚ÄîCalifornia-based Farmers Insurance agreed to a one-year sponsorship deal that infused much-needed cash and enthusiasm into the tournament. And though the golf gods didn‚Äôt exactly deliver a rousing champion in Ben Crane, Farmers rode in like a white knight and would come through again and again for the tournament over the next 17 years.

‚ÄúIt was the 11th hour of the 11th hour,‚Äù Tom Wilson, the Century Club‚Äôs then-tournament director, said at the time.

‚ÄúThey saved our bacon,‚Äù said Marty Gorisch, the current Farmers Insurance Open CEO.

The reminiscing these days carries a tinge of melancholy, because, as the PGA Tour and Century Club confirmed to Golf Digest on Friday, this will be Farmers' last year as the title sponsor. Though the company‚Äôs logo has already been seen prominently during broadcasts of the second-year, tech-infused TGL, Farmers is getting out of the major-league golf tournament business.

This ending has seemingly been written for at least a couple of years, during which no announcement came that Farmers was re-upping. But it‚Äôs also rare for the tour to acknowledge a sponsor‚Äôs farewell before its last hurrah. In this case, there was sentiment that Farmers should get to take a bow at the tournament that will be played Jan. 29-Feb. 1 on the Torrey Pines South and North courses, rather than shuffling off into the sunset when the final putt drops on Sunday.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôve been through the pandemic with them, date shifts with them, and weather with them,‚Äù Gorisch said. ‚ÄúAnd then we had some really amazing champions and did great charitable work. Business things are taking them in another direction now, but they started great, they‚Äôve been great, and they‚Äôre being classy right up until the end.

‚ÄúI just got off the phone with them,‚Äù Gorsich added. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre talking about the APGA [tournament] for this year and about our charities. They‚Äôre not going out with a whimper; they‚Äôre going out strong.‚Äù

The PGA Tour and Farmers Insurance each issued short, unattributed statements on Friday about the relationship.

‚ÄúFarmers Insurance has been a tremendous sponsor of the PGA Tour, and we cannot thank them enough for their support of the Farmers Insurance Open over the last 17 years,‚Äù the tour said in its statement.

Farmers‚Äô statement read, in part, ‚ÄúThe tournament has generated millions of dollars for charity and delighted golf fans in San Diego and beyond. As our sponsorship comes to an end, we celebrate everything we‚Äôve accomplished and wish the PGA Tour and the Century Club of San Diego continued success.‚Äù

Tiger Woods won the last of his eight titles at Torrey Pines at the 2013 Farmers Open.

According to the Century Club, during the Farmers era, $20 million in charitable donations were distributed, another $5 million of in-kind contributions were made, and 12,000 hours of volunteer time was logged. Farmers and the Century Club worked their way around the 2021 U.S. Open and significant renovations performed on both of Torrey Pines‚Äô courses. There were numerous fog delays, a couple of Monday finishes and one particularly violent storm in 2016 that forced evacuations from the property. Then came the news four years ago that the tournament would have to move to a Saturday finish so as not to conflict with the NFL playoffs. Farmers pressed on and even created a nationally televised showcase on those Sundays that gave unprecedented exposure to the minority APGA Tour.

The San Diego event is one of five on tour whose sponsorships run out after the 2026 season. The others are Sony at Waialae in Hawaii, Genesis at Riviera in Los Angeles, Schwab at Colonial in Fort Worth and Wyndham at Sedgefield in Greensboro, N.C. In each case, no re-signings or new sponsors have been announced for those events, and any further word seems unlikely until the tour‚Äôs newly formed Future Competition Committee (FCC) makes its recommendations, possibly sometime in the first quarter of 2026.

Until then, tournaments like those in San Diego find themselves in the odd position of being like a car maker marketing a new model that has yet to built. The parts are all there, but who‚Äôs going to buy it if they don‚Äôt know what it looks like? Potential sponsors want to understand a tournament‚Äôs future stature, cost structure and place on the schedule.

In San Diego and at Torrey Pines, Gorsich believes he has one the tour‚Äôs most marketable events, and tour sources indicate there is strong interest in San Diego among potential sponsors. This year‚Äôs tournament will be the 59th held at Torrey Pines, and there are only eight current venues that have been associated with the tour for at least 50 years. Two U.S. Opens have been staged on the South Course, and the list of winners in Farmers‚Äô time alone includes six different major champions. Beyond that, there are the drone shots of the Pacific Ocean coastline that are rivaled only by those at Pebble Beach.

‚ÄúIn our sport, the place you play means something,‚Äù Gorsich said. ‚ÄúBlindfold me, put me in front of the TV, and take the blindfold off‚Äîthere are a lot of courses it would take me a while to figure out. Torrey Pines is not one of those. Those watching know the history here, they know what Tiger or Jon Rahm did on certain holes. It‚Äôs a special place and people will watch that.‚Äù

San Diego might have one other big thing going for it in a tour schedule reshuffle: The chairman of the FCC is Woods, who attended his first tour event at Torrey Pines and and has won there eight times.

Now surrounded by three events on the West Coast Swing that have been designated as signatures, along with having a Saturday finish the last four years, the Torrey Pines tournament has gotten a bit lost in the noise of those, as evidenced by TV ratings that are far lower than in Woods' heyday. This year, however, the Farmers is back to a Sunday conclusion, and Gorsich said corporate hospitality and daily ticket sales are ‚Äúwell ahead‚Äù of where they have been in recent years.

There‚Äôs always chatter about strength of field, and the Farmers has seen some drop-off of players who most move the needle. Scottie Scheffler and Rory McIlroy, for example, have schedules that usually don‚Äôt include Torrey Pines. However, when the Genesis Invitational was moved last February on late notice to San Diego because of the fires in Los Angeles‚Äîonly three weeks after the Farmers was played‚Äîlarge crowds turned out to see the stars in the signature-level field, and the TV ratings were strong. Ludvig Aberg‚Äôs victory on Sunday drew an average of 3.4 million viewers, making it the most-watched non-major broadcast since the 2024 Players Championship.

For this year's Farmers, among the bigger names to have committed thus far are two past champions, Justin Rose and Max Homa, along with Hideki Matsuyama, Adam Scott, Patrick Cantlay and Tom Kim. The commitment deadline is Jan. 23.

Despite the challenges and changes he faces in coming months, Gorisch said he‚Äôs bullish on both his tournament and what the PGA Tour has in mind for its future.

‚ÄúGolf is hot and sponsors want to be in,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúTaking Torrey out of it, I‚Äôm excited about the change. It‚Äôs not change for change‚Äôs sake, right? Let‚Äôs strategically address some things that maybe we‚Äôve kept a certain way for a long time and really look at it thoughtfully. That‚Äôs exciting to me, and it should be exciting to any event, and they should respect that regardless of what it may mean for them.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs hard to argue with the fact that this is purposeful and thoughtful.‚Äù

title: Four arrested for $100k theft at California sports card shop
description: Pok√©mon and sports cards were stolen from LA Sports Cards
fullText:
Four men have been arrested in connection with the theft of $100,000 in collectibles at a sports card store in Burbank, California, the Burbank Police Department announced Thursday.

Brian Chavez, 22, of Los Angeles, Jeremy Lopez, 22, of Los Angeles, Marco Barrongil, 26, of North Hollywood, and Elijah Garcia, 27, of Compton, have been arrested and booked for burglary.

Formal charges are pending review.

According to police reports, the burglary occurred at 2 a.m. on Dec. 2 at LA Sports Cards. Police found ‚Äúevidence of forced entry at the front of the business‚Äù with the inside of the store damaged.

Pok√©mon cards, sports cards and other collectibles, with an estimated value of approximately $100,000, were among the items stolen.

Search warrants were served Dec. 18 and Jan. 8 at four separate locations. Evidence was found linking the suspects to the burglary, according to police.

Want more stories like this? 

Ben Burrows is a reporter and editor for cllct, the premier company for collectible culture. He was previously the collectibles editor at Sports Illustrated. You can follow him on X and Instagram @benmburrows.

title: Best Chargers vs Patriots Same Game Parlay for Sunday Night Football Wild Card Weekend
description: The Chargers draw a difficult setup traveling east into cold weather, where they‚Äôll face a fired-up Drake Maye and the Patriots in the Wild Card round as we dish on how he'll benefit in our same-game parlay for Sunday, January 11.
fullText:
Football bettors can be quick to discount quarterbacks making their postseason debut.

I don‚Äôt blame you. History might be working against New England Patriots QB Drake Maye, but while his passing prowess is in question his ability to run the ball isn‚Äôt.

My same-game parlay has Maye picking up rushing yards and cracking the end zone against the Los Angeles Chargers Sunday night.

Here are my best NFL same-game parlay picks and predictions for Chargers vs. Patriots on Sunday, January 11.

The half-point hook on New England Patriots -3.5 is enough to push me toward the moneyline. I believe New England wins what will be a grinder of a game, especially with the Los Angeles Chargers having to play in the cold in Foxborough.

Drake Maye‚Äôs rushing attempts were tempered down the stretch, as the team tried to protect him for the postseason. However, with everything on the line, New England unleashes Maye. His rushing yards projections sit as high as 31 yards.

The Chargers are extremely tough to pass against and tighten up in the red zone. That leaves Maye to do it himself when things break down close to the goal line.

Note if there is an applicable parlay boost available.

Odds are correct at the time of publishing and are subject to change.

title: Micky van der Ven emerges as Barcelona target with defender keen to leave Tottenham
description: Another name in the frame.
fullText:
Tottenham defender Micky van der Ven has reportedly emerged as a transfer target for Barcelona, with the Catalan giants believed to be eager to recruit a center-back in the summer transfer window.

Diario Sport are reporting that the Dutch star is eager to leave Tottenham and would prioritise a move to the Camp Nou.

The report highlights how he‚Äôs also able to play at left-back and that Tottenham would prefer to sell him abroad if he does make it clear he wants out at the end of the season.

Van der Ven has also made his admiration for Barcelona legend Carles Puyol recently in a chat on The Overlap which may or may not have helped spark this rumor into life.

‚ÄúMy idol is Carles Puyol, he always has been,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúHe was an elite player, a true leader at Barcelona. He wasn‚Äôt even that tall for a central defender, but he always headed corners and scored a lot of goals.

‚ÄúHe was a great player, he had a lot of strength. I liked the way he conducted himself on the pitch. He was the captain, simply, he was.‚Äù

Would Van der Ven be a good option for Barca? Let us know what you think in the comments below!

title: Orioles fans are expecting another rotation addition this winter
description: Most fans think Mike Elias has another big pitching move coming.
fullText:
Welcome to SB Nation Reacts, a survey of fans across the MLB. Throughout the year we ask questions of the most plugged-in Orioles fans and fans across the country.¬†

Whatever else happens between now and the start of the 2026 season, there‚Äôs no question that Mike Elias was busy this offseason, nor is there any question that he made serious moves to address weaknesses with last year‚Äôs team. Both the trade of Grayson Rodriguez and the acquisition of Shane Baz still are surprising, moves of a nature that he hasn‚Äôt really made before.

There is also still a lingering feeling about whether enough has been done with the rotation, particularly at the front end. If nobody else is brought in, then there is a lot riding on Kyle Bradish and Trevor Rogers remaining in good health and repeating something close to the performance we‚Äôve seen from them most recently. That pressure lessens if a signing or trade brings in someone with a strong track record who can keep that up.

In this week‚Äôs survey, I asked Orioles fans whether they think the team will make another starting pitching addition over the course of this offseason. An overwhelming majority said yes:

At this point, unless there‚Äôs a surprise addition to the trade market, the available names with some credible claim to being a front-of-the-rotation pitcher are free agents Ranger Su√°rez and Framber Valdez, and assumed-available Milwaukee starter Freddy Peralta.

Look close enough at Su√°rez and Valdez, as you must to think about signing them to the kind of deals they‚Äôve been believed to be seeking, and you can certainly find things to make you nervous about how their performance will hold up over the length of a substantial free agent contract. Yet Peralta would just be a one-year rental, so the Orioles would have to surrender young players or prospects who could help in the future for a guy they might only have this year.

How that might be addressed is still an open question, but Orioles fans clearly expect Elias to do something else big this winter.

This week‚Äôs survey was sponsored by FanDuel.

title: Iga Swiatek shares the city she loves playing tennis in the most
description: Tennis players have the luxury of playing all around the world, and Iga Swiatek‚Äôs career has taken her to every edge of the globe. The world number two has often called out the hectic nature of the WTA Tour schedule, but it has allowed her to travel the world.
fullText:
Tennis players have the luxury of playing all around the world, and Iga Swiatek‚Äôs career has taken her to every edge of the globe.

The world number two has often called out the hectic nature of the WTA Tour schedule, but it has allowed her to travel the world.

Swiatek has kickstarted her season at the United Cup in Australia, ahead of the first Grand Slam of the year at the Australian Open.

At the event, the Polish star has named the city she loves so much that she thinks she could live there.

Swiatek is currently playing for Poland in the United Cup in Sydney and she‚Äôs opened up about her adoration for the city.

Speaking at the United Cup, the world number two said: ‚ÄúI love being here. I could honestly live here ‚Äî I love Sydney.‚Äù

Swiatek‚Äôs form has been impressive at the United Cup in Sydney, where she has beaten Eva Lys, Suzan Lamens, and Maya Joint.

That‚Äôs only boosted Swiatek‚Äôs love for Sydney, which the Pole said was ‚ÄúBecoming my favourite city in the whole world. I really have fun here.‚Äù

Swiatek‚Äôs next match in Sydney will be against Coco Gauff as Poland face the United States for a place in the final of the United Cup.

Swiatek might have a great passion for Sydney, but she‚Äôs never played her best tennis on the WTA Tour‚Äôs Australian swing.

The star is yet to win the United Cup for Poland in three attempts, with her best effort coming in 2025 when she lost to the United States in the final.

The Australian Open is also the only Grand Slam that the Polish star is yet to win, having been knocked out at the semi-final stage on two occasions in 2022 and 2025.

Swiatek‚Äôs only victory on Australian soil came all the way back in 2021, when she won the Adelaide International.

The Pole defeated Belinda Bencic in the final, but she has failed even to reach a final in singles competition in Australia since.

title: Ketel Marte trade off the table? Diamondbacks GM has update amid MLB rumors
description: The Arizona Diamondbacks will not be trading star second baseman Ketel Marte, general manager Mike Hazen said on Friday, Jan. 9.
fullText:
The Arizona Diamondbacks will not trade second baseman Ketel Marte, general manager Mike Hazen said on Friday, Jan. 9, bringing an end to months of discussions about a possible deal.

The club had explored the possibility of a trade in the hopes of bringing back younger, cheaper players. A deal also would have shed payroll that could have then been reallocated.

Hazen has said over the past month that he did not want the talks to drag much beyond the start of the year. He wanted to turn his focus to finding other ways to upgrade his roster.

The Diamondbacks seemed interested in making a deal happen if the right one presented itself. Apparently, one never did.

One possible reason was that the club was said to have had a high asking price that rival clubs were reluctant to reach. Teams also might have preferred to take their chances on the free-agent market, which still features several unsigned star position players.

Another possibility is that clubs were concerned about Marte‚Äôs makeup and fit in a new clubhouse, particularly after he upset teammates by missing games after the All-Star break last year following a break-in at his Scottsdale home, an incident for which he later apologized.

Keeping Marte, of course, is far from a bad outcome for the Diamondbacks. He has been the best second baseman in the majors over the past few seasons, accumulating 16 Wins Above Replacement (WAR), per Baseball-Reference, the most at the position.

It could, however, make it more difficult for the club to shore up its pitching staff.

The Diamondbacks have rounded out their rotation this winter by bringing back free-agent Merrill Kelly and signing veteran Michael Soroka, but the bullpen, a major trouble spot in recent seasons, remains unchanged and in need of upgrades.

Hazen has said he remains engaged in the free-agent and trade markets in search of bullpen help.

This article originally appeared on Arizona Republic: Ketel Marte trade won't happen despite rumors, Diamondbacks GM says

title: Carlos Baleba: Real Madrid enter transfer race for Man United target
description: Manchester United‚Äôs pursuit of Carlos Baleba has taken a sharp twist as Real Madrid have stormed into the race for the 21-year-old midfielder ‚Äì but the Red Devils remain at the front of the queue....
fullText:
Manchester United‚Äôs pursuit of Carlos Baleba has taken a sharp twist as Real Madrid have stormed into the race for the 21-year-old midfielder ‚Äì but the Red Devils remain at the front of the queue.

United‚Äôs priority in the transfer market is a much-needed overhaul of their midfield.

The ongoing uncertainty over the current cohort at Old Trafford ‚Äî Bruno Fernandes, Casemiro, Manuel Ugarte and Kobbie Mainoo ‚Äî means that two recruits are expected to arrive, whether in January or during the summer window.

United‚Äôs first-choice targets are Elliot Anderson, Adam Wharton, and Baleba, whom the club made advances to sign last year. However, Brighton & Hove Albion‚Äôs refusal to enter negotiations prevented a deal from being struck.

There was firm expectation United would return to the south coast again for the Cameroon international, who is representing his country at the African Cup of Nations alongside his compatriot ‚Äî and Red Devil ‚Äî Bryan Mbeumo.

The pair are hoping to propel the Indomitable Lions to their sixth AFCON triumph, with Baleba‚Äôs ‚Äúcommanding‚Äù performances making him one of the standout stars at the tournament in Morocco so far.

It‚Äôs understood that interest in Baleba was primarily driven by the recently departed Ruben Amorim, however, who had identified the Brighton enforcer as an ideal fit in his 3-4-2-1 system.

INEOS‚Äôs decision to dismiss Amorim on Monday morning sent shockwaves across English football, sparking a wave of questions about the long-term direction of the club.

But it also creates doubt over United‚Äôs continued interest in Baleba, given the biggest proponent of his signing is no longer at Old Trafford.

And this is further complicated by a report from Spain that Real Madrid have locked on to the Cameroonian as a potential solution to their midfield woes.

Defensa Central reveals Los Blancos are ‚Äúclosely examining‚Äù the prospect of launching a raid for Baleba this summer, as they search for a new option in Xabi Alonso‚Äôs engine room.

The Spanish powerhouse has dispatched scouts to the Amex Stadium to watch the 21-year-old in action this season ‚Äî and they have delivered positive reports, despite his erratic form in comparison to last year.

But Fichajes contends that officials at the Bernabeu consider Brighton‚Äôs asking price ‚Äî said to be ‚Äúaround ‚Ç¨90 million‚Äù ‚Äî too expensive for a player still so raw, and so have ruled out a move.

This conflicts with reports in England that the Seagulls‚Äô valuation is in excess of ¬£100m (‚Ç¨115m), though a more expensive figure would just further compound Madrid‚Äôs decision, rather than change it.

Regardless, Madrid‚Äôs movements are a positive development for United, should INEOS decide to maintain their pursuit of Baleba even without Amorim at the helm.

A European juggernaut, with an excellent scouting system, considers Baleba an excellent midfield prospect, but lacks the financial will to follow through on their interest.

This validates United‚Äôs interest in the Cameroonian, while eliminating a potential rival for his signature. It is a win-win for a club who has endured too many losses recently, on and off the pitch.

Featured image Ryan Pierse via Getty Images

The Peoples Person has been one of the world‚Äôs leading Man United news sites for over a decade. bsky.social

title: Iowa football freshman DB enters transfer portal
description: CJ Bell, a freshman defensive back for the Iowa Hawkeyes, has entered the transfer portal.
fullText:
The transfer portal continues to churn, and the Iowa Hawkeyes are seeing a departure from a young defensive back, who is electing to explore opportunities elsewhere.

CJ Bell, a freshman defensive back for the Iowa Hawkeyes, posted on his X account today that he is entering the transfer portal and will have four years of eligiblity with his new program.

"I'm extremely grateful to the University of Iowa for the opportunity, the relationships I've built, and the lessons I've learned during my time here. I was able to redshirt this past season, and with that, I'll be entering the transfer portal with four years of eligibility remaining.

"I appreciate everyone who has supported me along the way. I'm excited for the next chapter and looking forward to what's ahead.

"For any recruitment or communication, please contact my representatives at NXTERA Sports," Bell said via his post on X.

Thank you Iowa üñ§ üíõ pic.twitter.com/3ILIarxQ1y

‚Äî Charles ‚ÄúCJ‚Äù Bell (@CjBell_24) January 9, 2026

CJ Bell spent one year with the Hawkeyes and appeared in just one game against the Indiana Hoosiers. The 6-foot-1, 186-pound product of Mansfield High School, in Mansfield, Massachusetts, was a three-star recruit ranked as the No. 97 cornerback in the class of 2025, per 247Sports.

Coming out of high school, Bell held offers from Rutgers, Boston College, Maryland, Minnesota, Penn State, Tennessee, Wisconsin, Notre Dame, Temple, Bowling Green, UConn, and UMass.

title: 2025-26 Mountain West Bracketology: January 9
description: Happy Friday, everyone! As we continue forward with the Mountain West men‚Äôs basketball season, we will be updating the conference‚Äôs bracketology outlook as we approach the big dance in March! Let‚Äôs dive into this week‚Äôs update! At Large Candidates: Utah State: NET: 16 KenPom: 26 Lunardi: No. 7 seed Bracket Matrix (out of 58 brackets; Jan.
fullText:
Happy Friday, everyone! As we continue forward with the Mountain West men‚Äôs basketball season, we will be updating the conference‚Äôs bracketology outlook as we approach the big dance in March! Let‚Äôs dive into this week‚Äôs update!

Bracket Matrix¬†(out of 58 brackets; Jan. 7): 58

Average Bracket Matrix Seed: 7.43

Skinny: Utah State remains the lone soul for an at-large bid. The only way the MW currently nets multiple bids is if the field ‚Äî not Utah State ‚Äî wins the MW Title. They are the only program in the top-40 in NET and in the top-45 in KenPom. They will be tested within the next week against a struggling Boise State on the road on Saturday, and Nevada at home on Wednesday, Jan. 14.

Average Bracket Matrix Seed: 9.77

Skinny: It was a rough week for Boise State. They dropped 10 spots in KenPom and 24 spots from last week‚Äôs NET as a result of their triple overtime loss to San Diego State and 17-point loss to Grand Canyon. Obviously, the latter stings much more than the former. It‚Äôs looking more realistic that Boise‚Äôs only path to making the NCAA Tournament is a MW championship, despite topping the conference in Quad 1 wins (2) when the field has three combined.

Average Bracket Matrix Seed: 10

Skinny: New Mexico received the biggest bump from last week‚Äôs bracketology. They jumped 22 spots in NET, beating Wyoming (Quad 3) at home by 20 before beating Colorado State by 10 inside Moby Arena. Winners of nine of their last 10, they have a pretty soft schedule coming up, with six of their next seven being Quad 3 or 4 games. The Lobos are now 4-3 in Quad 1-2 games, with their next being on Jan. 17 against SDSU.

Average Bracket Matrix Seed: 11

Skinny: While it picked up a pair of Quad 2 wins over Boise and Nevada, the Aztecs moved up just 11 spots in NET and are still on the outside-looking-in. They have three Quad 2 games over the next two weeks against Wyoming, New Mexico and Grand Canyon, which could be pushed to Quad 3 if Grand Canyon (currently 97 in NET) falls out of the top-100.

title: Villanova at Marquette: Game Preview
description: A golden opportunity to get back on track
fullText:
Villanova Wildcats 12-3 (3-1) at Marquette Golden Eagles 6-10 (1-4)

Where: Fiserv Forum (Milwaukee, WI)

When:¬†Saturday, Jan. 10 at 2:30 PM

How to Listen: Villanova Sports Radio Network

Net Rankings:¬†Villanova 29, Marquette 156 (Quad 3 opportunity)

KenPom:¬†Villanova 25, Marquette 116

Torvik:¬†Villanova 30, Marquette 137

About Marquette: The Golden Eagles have really struggled this year, as evidenced by their record. Since the new landscape with year-to-year transfers has started, head coach Shaka Smart has gone against the grain. Smart has not dipped into the transfer portal, instead opting for the old-school way of developing. It‚Äôs admirable, but this year it seems to have caught up with them, despite returning 10 players from last year‚Äôs NCAA tournament team.

Marquette is led by Big East First-Team selection Chase Ross. The 6‚Äô5‚Äù senior guard averages 16 points, 4.3 rebounds and 3.2 assists per game. Though his percentages are down significantly, from both the field and from deep, from a year ago. Behind Ross is freshman Nigel James Jr. The 6‚Äô guard was a 4-star recruit, and thus far is averaging 12.4 points and a team-leading 3.9 assists per contest. That‚Äôs the list for double-digit scorers. The Golden Eagles have 12 players who average at least 7 minutes per game, but as of late they are using a 9-man rotation. Sixth-leading scorer Sean Jones has missed the past two games with a foot injury.

Marquette is currently 342nd in the country in three-point percentage, averaging 29.5% as a team. The Golden Eagles are even worse from the field, shooting 40.3% (good for 344th at the moment). Those struggles extend to the free-throw line, where Marquette shoots it at 69.2% (0.1% better than Villanova).

Notes on Nova: The Wildcats are coming off of a tough loss at home against Creighton. The defense in the second half was a huge problem, so the opportunity is there to bounce back on that end against a well-below average Marquette team. Marquette also struggles to defend the rim (only 0.5 blocks per game more than Villanova), so if the ‚ÄòCats are patient they should be able to get what they want on offense. Matt Hodge, Bryce Lindsay and Devin Askew are all looking for better performances in Milwaukee, where the Wildcats have already picked up a win this year against Wisconsin.

title: Boston Celtics vs. Toronto Raptors: Stream, lineups, injury reports, broadcast (1/9)
description: The Celtics should win vs. the Raps, but this is not a team to take lightly unless Boston wants a streak of a different sort on their hands.
fullText:
The Boston Celtics will play host to the Toronto Raptors at their home arena of TD Garden this Friday (Jan. 9) evening. As they do so, the Celtics will be looking to bounce back from a loss to the Denver Nuggets at home earlier in the week and work to regain their highest ranking in the East this season to date. The Raptors, on the other hand, are looking to keep their current win streak alive while trying to climb back up to Boston's range in the East.

The Celtics should come away with a win vs. the Raptors, but this is not a team to take lightly unless Boston wants a streak of a different sort on their hands come the final buzzer.

At present, the Celtics have a 23-13 record and a four-game win streak coming into tonight's contest. That has them third in the Eastern Conference standings.

The Raptors are the owners of a 23-15 record, good enough for fourth place in the East.

Boston lost to the Denver Nuggets 114-110 at home.

Toronto beat the Charlotte Hornets 97-96 on the road.

For the Celtics, Jayson Tatum (Achilles) is out, as is Josh Minott (ankle).

For the Raptors, Jakob Poeltl (back) is out, and Scottie Barnes (knee), and Brandon Ingram (thumb) are questionable.

title: Cowboys set interview schedule for first 3 DC candidates
description: The Cowboys will look to 3 rising assistants to begin their DC search. The first round of interviews are set to take place Friday and Saturday.
fullText:
The Cowboys are set to begin interviews for their defensive coordinator opening. Just 72 hours after the firing of Matt Eberflus, the team will kick off the conversations to find his replacement with three meetings reportedly over the next two days.

Per NFL Network insider Ian Rapoport, the Cowboys will interview Vikings assistant Daronte Jones and Browns assistant Ephraim Banda on Friday, with Broncos assistant Jim Leonhard rounding out the current slate on Saturday.

The Cowboys had hoped to also speak with Falcons assistant Jeff Ulbrich but was denied permission, as Atlanta reportedly hopes to keep him on staff to serve under their next as-yet-unnamed head coach.

#Cowboys will conduct their 1st round of defensive coordinator interviews today, speaking with #Vikings defensive pass game coordinator Daronte Jones and #Browns safeties coach Ephraim Banda, then they'll speak with #Broncos defensive pass game coordinator Jim Leonhard tomorrow.

‚Äî Ian Rapoport (@RapSheet) January 9, 2026

Head coach Brian Schottenheimer said earlier in the week that the process of evaluating their current coaching staff could take "10 to 12 days," but announced a parting of the ways with Eberflus the following day, after a historically poor season that saw the Dallas defense give up a franchise-worst 30 points per game.

Cowboys owner Jerry Jones explained in the team's season-ending press conference that neither prior head coaching nor coordinator experience at the pro level would be considered a prerequisite for the current DC job; none of the current candidates have either.

Here's a quick look at the first three interviewees for the role.

Jones has been Minnesota's defensive pass game coordinator since 2023 and was the Vikings' defensive backs coach in 2022 and also in 2020 (with a year as LSU's defensive coordinator in between). The 47-year-old is thought to bring a lot of the qualities that the team likes in current Vikings DC Brian Flores. The Jets have also requested permission to interview Jones for their DC job.

Banda, 44, has coached the Browns' safeties since 2023, hired to the job by current defensive coordinator Jim Schwartz. Despite the team's 5-12 record this season, Banda safeties Grant Delpit and Ronnie Hickman helped the team put up top-three numbers in passing yards allowed. Prior to Cleveland, Banda spent a dozen years in the college ranks; he worked defensive quality control at Mississippi State in 2015, Dak Prescott's senior year.

Leonhard is considered by many to be a rising star in the coaching world. After 10 years as an NFL safety, he went back to his alma mater of Wisconsin to begin his coaching career and then returned to Denver (where he played in 2012) to be the Broncos' defensive backs coach and pass game coordinator in 2024. Last year, the 43-year-old added assistant head coach to his job duties. Leonhard has history with Brian Schottenheimer; he was a Jet for three years while Schottenheimer was offensive coordinator there.

Todd is on X at¬†@ToddBrock24f7. Also, follow¬†Cowboys Wire on Facebook¬†to join in on the conversation with fellow fans!

This article originally appeared on Cowboys Wire: Cowboys set interview schedule for first 3 DC candidates

title: Grizzlies reportedly open to trade offers for Ja Morant
description: The Memphis Grizzlies are reportedly open to trade offers for Ja Morant.
fullText:
The Memphis Grizzlies are reportedly open to trade offers for Ja Morant, according to ESPN's Shams Charania.

Multiple teams are interested, per Charania, and the Grizzlies are reportedly looking for draft picks and young players in return. Yahoo Sports' Kevin O'Connor highlighted Miami, Minnesota and Sacramento as potential trade fits.

With the emergence of their young players, the 16-21 Grizzlies are considering multiple approaches to building their team. One of them is building around 2023 Defensive Player of the Year Jaren Jackson Jr. Jackson is averaging 18.5 points, 5.6 rebounds and 1.5 blocks per game this season.

Despite the Grizzlies being open to moving Morant, the team is also willing to keep the 26-year-old point guard. In recent seasons, Morant's biggest issues have been staying on the court.

This season, Morant has only played in 19 games and has missed the last three games with a calf injury. Morant has already been ruled out for Friday's game against the Oklahoma City Thunder.

Just in: For the first time, the Memphis Grizzlies are entertaining offers to potentially move two-time All-Star Ja Morant ahead of the Feb. 5 NBA trade deadline, sources tell ESPN. pic.twitter.com/SD0RT9Jhuj

‚Äî Shams Charania (@ShamsCharania) January 9, 2026

This breaking news story will be updated.

title: Senegal reach CAN semi-finals as Ndiaye shines and controversial red card
description: The Senegal national team confirmed their favoritism and secured a spot in the semifinals of the Africa Cup of Nations by defeating Mali 1-0.In a match marked by physical balance, the individual talen...
fullText:
The Senegal national team confirmed their favoritism and secured a spot in the semifinals of the Africa Cup of Nations by defeating Mali 1-0.

In a match marked by physical balance, the individual talent of the "Lions of Teranga" made the difference in the final score.

The only goal of the match was scored by Iliman Ndiaye. The forward showed opportunism and composure to beat the Malian goalkeeper in the 28th minute.

Mali's situation, which was already complicated by being behind on the scoreboard, became dramatic in the final moments of the first half.

Star player Yves Bissouma received a controversial red card, leaving his team one man down for the entire second half.

Now, Senegal awaits the winner of Egypt vs. Ivory Coast ‚Äì this match will take place on Saturday (10th) at 4 p.m. (Bras√≠lia time).

The semifinal is scheduled for next Wednesday (14th) at 2 p.m.

title: Nebraska Reacts Survey Results: Husker Nation Believes in HUSKERS HOOPS
description: How will Nebraska fare in conference? And do you believe they‚Äôll get that elusive NCAA win?
fullText:
If you check the Big 10 conference standings today, you will be treated to a sight very rarely witnessed:

Yep, that is your Nebraska Cornhuskers sitting atop the B1G standings and there they shall remain until at least early Saturday afternoon following their tilt with he storied Indiana Hoosiers. The Hoosiers are a 70% favorite according to ESPN‚Äôs matchup predictor and currently own a 10-0 record on their home floor where the game will be played.

However, the surprising Cornhuskers are 15-0 and own the nation‚Äôs longest winning streak at 19 thanks to their 4-game run to glory in the esteemed College Basketball Crown tournament. Much like their tilts against Illinois, Michigan State and Ohio State, few believe in them. And, of course, the streak has to end sometime.

But do you want to bet against the streak and these guys?

OK, enough rambling, here are your survey results:

Corn Nation seems to be pretty measured here. Only 16% went for the extreme with 12% thinking the Huskers will win 12 or more of the remaining 16 games and 4% saying it will come crashing down to the tune of 5 or fewer wins the rest of the way.

40% believe they will settle in winning 6-8 of the remaining 16 which should (?) be enough earn a tournament bid and go after the elephant in Nebraska basketball‚Äôs room.

And, finally, 44% see Nebrasketball notching 13-15 total conference wins which should firmly secure the Big Dance ticket and a final record around 25-6 which would set them right alongside the 1991 squad in the argument for who is the Huskers Hoops GOAT.

No drawn out explanations needed here.

title: NFL Moneyline Picks for Every Wild Card Game
description: The Pittsburgh Steelers may have escaped elimination in Week 18, but their luck will run out on Wild Card Weekend against the red-hot Houston Texans.
fullText:
The playoffs have finally arrived, and we‚Äôre locked and loaded with six matchups spanning Saturday through Monday.

Headlined by the Houston Texans spoiling the party in Steeltown, here are my favorite moneyline NFL picks for every game during Wild Card Weekend.

Although Carolina upset Los Angeles 31‚Äì28 in Week 13, an uncharacteristic game from Matthew Stafford saw the Rams‚Äô gunslinger turn the ball over three times, including the Panthers offense going a ridiculous 3-for-3 on fourth down.

The Rams‚Äô scoring unit remains elite across all key metrics, finishing the year first in points per game (30.5), and Sean McVay won‚Äôt allow a repeat stumble at Bank of America Stadium.

Read our full Rams vs. Panthers predictions.

It‚Äôs hard to overlook Jordan Love‚Äôs playoff experience compared with Caleb Williams.

If it weren‚Äôt for Chicago‚Äôs miraculous Week 16 comeback over Green Bay, the Packers would be slight favorites ‚Äî but I‚Äôll take the Packers, who remain stronger on defense despite injuries.

Chicago‚Äôs stock is at an all-time high right now, making this a perfect time to push back against the public.

Read our full Packers vs. Bears predictions.

Get ready for a battle between the No. 1 rushing offense and the No. 1 rushing defense.

While it‚Äôs hard to ignore Josh Allen‚Äôs mastery under center, Jacksonville has won nine of its last 10 games, and Liam Coen has Trevor Lawrence playing the best football of his career.

With Buffalo remaining banged up on D, I‚Äôll side with the home team to open the Sunday slate.

San Francisco has been an incredible story, and Kyle Shanahan deserves a ton of credit for getting this injury-riddled roster to the postseason... but last week‚Äôs loss to Seattle hurt in more ways than one.

Not only did that home loss to Seattle cost them the No. 1 seed in the NFC, but starting linebacker Dee Winters is now listed as questionable after leaving the game with an ankle injury, while Tatum Bethune is done for the rest of the season (groin).

Already without All-Pro stars Fred Warner and Nick Bosa, a fully healthy Eagles team will send the 49ers packing on Saturday.

Considering the state of the Chargers‚Äô offensive line, this isn‚Äôt a team that can afford to play from behind in Foxborough.

As good as the Chargers‚Äô defense has been this season, Drake Maye is going to move the ball at some point, and the Patriots faithful will be rearing to go for their first home playoff game since 2019.

Bank on Justin Herbert remaining winless in the postseason.

While Houston enters the postseason on the back of nine straight wins, the Steelers have essentially backed their way into the playoffs, barely squeaking by in Week 18 following a missed field goal at the buzzer by Baltimore kicker Tyler Loop.

Pittsburgh‚Äôs sluggish offense remains a tough watch, and the Houston Texans‚Äô vaunted pass rush will make life miserable for Aaron Rodgers.

Mike Tomlin has lost six straight playoff games dating back a decade, and another quick exit is in store on Monday.

This article originally appeared on Covers.com, read the full article here

title: Rabiot ‚Äònot worried‚Äô about Milan Scudetto chances: ‚ÄòThere is a long way to go until May‚Äô
description: Adrien Rabiot urged calm after Milan were held to a frustrating 1-1 draw by Genoa, insisting the Scudetto race remains wide open despite another missed opportunity in the title chase.The Rossoneri fai...
fullText:
Adrien Rabiot urged calm after Milan were held to a frustrating 1-1 draw by Genoa, insisting the Scudetto race remains wide open despite another missed opportunity in the title chase.

The Rossoneri failed to make their dominance count and were left to settle for a point, a result that left a sense of regret within the squad.

Rabiot admitted Milan did not manage the game as well as they should have, particularly in the opening stages.

‚ÄúWe started well, then we conceded,‚Äù the midfielder explained, with quotes via MilanNews, conceding that the first half fell short of expectations, ‚Äúespecially in front of goal.‚Äù

TURIN, ITALY ‚Äì DECEMBER 08: Adrien Rabiot of AC Milan celebrates scoring his team‚Äôs first goal with teammate Matteo Gabbia during the Serie A match between Torino FC and AC Milan at Stadio Olimpico di Torino on December 08, 2025 in Turin, Italy. (Photo by Valerio Pennicino/Getty Images)

Milan improved markedly after the break and pushed for a winner, but Rabiot acknowledged that the failure to kill off the match left them exposed late on.

‚ÄúIn the second half we played better, but unfortunately we didn‚Äôt manage to win. In the end we even risked losing it, and that‚Äôs not something that should happen,‚Äù he said.

‚ÄúThere was time to create chances, we had the match in our hands and we need to do better in certain situations.‚Äù

The Frenchman also highlighted a recurring issue that has crept into Milan‚Äôs performances this season: slow starts.

‚ÄúWe always tell ourselves to start well, but sometimes we‚Äôre not there mentally,‚Äù Rabiot admitted.

While praising the team‚Äôs second-half response, he was clear that relying on late surges is not enough. ‚ÄúWe do better after the break, but we can‚Äôt play only 50 minutes per match. We‚Äôll keep working on this, especially on the mental side.‚Äù

MILAN, ITALY ‚Äì SEPTEMBER 23: Adrien Rabiot of AC Milan applauds the fans following the final whistle of the Coppa Italia Frecciarossa Round of 16 match between AC Milan and US Lecce at Giuseppe Meazza Stadium on September 23, 2025 in Milan, Italy. (Photo by Jonathan Moscrop/Getty Images)

Despite the dropped points, Rabiot rejected any suggestion of panic regarding Milan‚Äôs title ambitions.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs January,‚Äù he stressed. ‚ÄúThe season goes until May, there are many matches and many head-to-head games. We need to stay calm, recover our energy for Sunday and keep going.‚Äù

Milan, he concluded, remain firmly in contention. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre there,‚Äù Rabiot said. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not worried.‚Äù

title: USWNT fullback Jenna Nighswonger to leave Arsenal on loan
description: Jenna Nighswonger is set to leave Arsenal on loan, head coach Ren√©e Slegers confirmed on Friday.
fullText:
Jenna Nighswonger is set to leave Arsenal on loan, head coach Ren√©e Slegers confirmed on Friday.

At a press conference ahead of Saturday's game against Manchester United, Slegers said the U.S. women's national team fullback would be on the move.

"Jenna will not be in the squad tomorrow, and she's close to a loan move," said the Dutch coach.

Nighswonger has struggled mightily for playing time since she joined Arsenal from Gotham FC in January 2025.

The 25-year-old has played just 16 minutes this season, frequently being omitted from the team's matchday squad entirely.

Overall, Nighswonger has made just five appearances for Arsenal since she joined, including one start.

Nighswonger's lack of minutes at the club level has seen her lose her place within the USWNT, which she hasn't represented since February 2025.

The fullback has 20 caps for the USWNT, making her debut in 2023 and helping the team win a gold medal at the Olympics the following year.

Gotham FC selected Nighswonger with the fourth overall pick in the 2023 NWSL Draft, and she went on to win Rookie of the Year while helping her team win the NWSL championship in her debut campaign.

This article originally appeared on USA TODAY: USWNT fullback Jenna Nighswonger to leave Arsenal on loan

title: We now know real reason Hawks traded Trae Young to Wizards
description: It now makes sense why the Atlanta Hawks parted ways with their superstar point guard.
fullText:
We now know real reason Hawks traded Trae Young to Wizards originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

While trading Trae Young appeared to be a long shot for the Atlanta Hawks last season, it seemed more realistic this season.

Young, who‚Äôs been injured for most of the season and is shooting a career-low 30.5% shooting from three, was at a standstill with the organization through 7.5 seasons. As a result, the Hawks traded the four-time All-Star to the Washington Wizards on Wednesday for CJ McCollum and Corey Kispert.

On Friday, the real reason the Hawks completed the blockbuster deal was revealed.

‚ÄúOn behalf of the Hawks franchise, I‚Äôd like to thank Trae for how he embraced the city of Atlanta and represented the Hawks during his time here, on the court and in the community,‚Äù Hawks GM Onsi Saleh said in an official statement.

‚ÄúOver more than seven seasons, including four All-Star appearances, he cemented himself as a fan favorite and one of the great players in our franchise‚Äôs history. We wish Trae and his family all the best.‚Äù

‚ÄúAdding CJ McCollum, one of the NBA‚Äôs most prolific shooters and a respected veteran, along with an established young veteran in Corey Kispert, will strengthen our team on the court and in the locker room, and we retain flexibility for future opportunities to continue building our program.‚Äù

Essentially, while Saleh respects and appreciates Young‚Äôs contributions to the Hawks‚Äô organizations, both parties desperately needed a reset. Atlanta, which is firmly in rebuild mode, added McCollum and Kispert to help jump-start that process and move the organization in the right direction.

The Hawks don‚Äôt have any ill will toward their 2018 No. 3 overall pick, but simply put, it was time for a change.

More NBA:¬†Knicks cut ties with Jalen Brunson's 6-foot-8 teammate after less than two seasons

description: ¬© IMAGO Even though he's only 28 years old, Joe Gomez has become part of the furniture at Liverpool.LFC x adidas Shop the away range TODAY LFC x adidas Shop the home range today! LFC x adidas Shop th...
fullText:
Even though he's only 28 years old, Joe Gomez has become part of the furniture at Liverpool.

Shop the goalkeeper range today

Shop the third kit range today!

In fact, there have even been times when the Englishman has been seen as one of the best centre-backs at the club.

However, due to the sheer number of injuries he's suffered, his performances have taken a massive hit with Arne Slot barely trusting him.

But, since Bradley is now likely to be side-lined for an extended period after the injury he sustained against Arsenal, now could be Gomez's time to shine.

Indeed, the Reds do have Jeremie Frimpong, Dominik Szoboszlai and even Curtis Jones who can be used at right-back but, since the Reds' need to shore their defence up massively, Gomez feels like the obvious choice to plug the gap.

Szoboszlai and Frimpong could both do decent jobs if called upon but, on the face of things, Slot would be silly to not give the Englishman a run out, especially with the 2026 World Cup just around the corner.

Gomez making England's World Cup squad wasn't even in the mind of most people when the 2025-26 season kicked off.

However, since he's manage to keep fit and is now likely to be used a lot more often, this could be his time to shine.

The centre-back has been described as an "exceptional" player on more than one occasion with his true colours even shining through at some points this term.

If Slot does choose to trust the 28-year-old and he plays well, Thomas Tuchel could end up considering him for the 2026 World Cup.

And, the fact that he can play anywhere across the back four massively plays in his favour.

Of course, Bradley's injury is the last thing that anyone would have wanted at Liverpool but, for Gomez, it could be exactly what he needed to prove his worth.

title: 3 bold predictions for Alabama's home matchup vs. Texas
description: The Tide will look to get back in the win column following a 96-90 loss on the road to Vanderbilt. Here are three bold takes for the Texas game.
fullText:
The Alabama Crimson Tide will host the Texas Longhorns at Coleman Coliseum on Saturday night.

The Tide enter the matchup following a Top 15 road loss to the Vanderbilt Commodores, as a multitude of injuries ultimately cost Alabama the game. Labaron Philon Jr. recorded 18 points on 5-of-9 shooting despite playing just 19 minutes, as the star guard left the game with full-body cramps and was unable to return in the second half.

Aden Holloway and Latrell Wrightsell could see an increase in playing time, should Philon remain sidelined, but the Tide will look to get the sharpshooter back from injury as soon as possible, starting with this game against Texas.

Here are three bold takes for Alabama's matchup against Texas.

Holloway recorded 22 points on 9-of-18 shooting during Wednesday night's loss, as the junior guard was able to step up and play at an elite level following Philon's injury. The former Auburn star could thrive once again if Philon is unable to play, as the sharpshooter has proven to shine with an increased workload on numerous occasions in the past. Holloway is currently shooting an impressive 46.7% from behind the arc, as the star will look to stay hot on Saturday evening.

Sherrell has played a critical role on both ends of the floor for the Crimson Tide. The talented big man currently leads the team in blocks with 2.8 per game, and Sherrell's presence on the glass has undoubtedly been missed while he has been sidelined. The sophomore forward could be in prime position for a major performance should he return on Saturday night, as the Tide continue to slowly get healthier as the season progresses.

Allen has continued to turn heads throughout the first few months of the 2025-26 season. The impressive freshman led the Crimson Tide in points with 25 during Wednesday night's loss in Nashville, as Allen has quickly earned himself a much larger role and has thrived in recent weeks. Allen could benefit from Philon's injury should he remain out on Saturday, but ultimately the freshman could still be in for another big night nonetheless.

Contact/Follow us¬†@RollTideWire¬†on X, and like our page on¬†Facebook¬†to follow ongoing coverage of¬†Alabama¬†news, notes and opinion.

title: 2026 Willie McCovey Memorial Community Prospect List No. 27
description: Who is the No. 27 prospect in the system?
fullText:
The 2026 baseball season is so close that I can almost taste it. And that means the return of not just Major League Baseball, but also Minor League Baseball. But how can Minor League Baseball begin without prospect lists?? It simply cannot. And so we must finish our 2026 Willie McCovey Memorial Community Prospect List, in which we will rank the top 44 prospects in the San Francisco Giants organization. We‚Äôre comfortably past the halfway mark, so we can‚Äôt stop now!

Wednesday‚Äôs ballot resulted in a fairly one-sided election, and it brings us one of the more hotly debated prospects in the system: left-handed pitcher Joe Whitman, who has been voted as the No. 26 prospect in the system, dropping 17 spots from his ranking of No. 9 last year.

Whitman was a compensation round selection in the 2023 draft, being taken with the pick the Giants received when Carlos Rod√≥n signed with the New York Yankees. With the 69th overall pick, the Giants made Whitman the first college southpaw taken in the draft.

The Kent State product hasn‚Äôt quite lived up to that draft billing, though he‚Äôs shown some interesting flashes. He spent the entirety of the 2025 season with AA Richmond, where his numbers were so-so: in 117.1 innings, he sported an ugly ERA of 5.29, but with a much-better FIP of 3.61, with 9.51 strikeouts and 3.61 walks per nine innings and a 41.2% groundball rate.

Interestingly, Whitman‚Äôs ERA underperforming his FIP seems to be a trend: in 2024, his first full season (which was split between Low and High-A), he posted a 3.80 FIP but just a 4.63 ERA.

Whitman ‚Äî who turned 24 in September ‚Äî poses an interesting problem for prospect evaluation, due to a fairly black-and-white issue: his fastball is not good at all. According to Baseball America, Whitman‚Äôs fastball got torched last year to the tune of a .305/.372/.469 slash line in a very pitcher-friendly Eastern League, and all of the home runs he allowed came on that pitch. Needless to say, the fact that he stayed afloat with hitters teeing off on his fastball speaks highly to the rest of his arsenal ‚Ä¶ but you can‚Äôt make the Majors, let alone survive there, without a fastball. And giving up far more hits than innings pitched in the Eastern League is a pretty damning preview of what‚Äôs to come without a fastball fix.

And so, the case with Whitman becomes pretty straightforward, if convoluted when trying to assign value to it. If he can fix his fastball, which sits low-90s, he‚Äôll probably have a lengthy career as a Major League starter. If he can‚Äôt fix his fastball, he faces an uphill battle just to get a cup of coffee as a reliever. How do you blend those truths? Well, by making him the No. 26 prospect in the system, apparently.

Needless to say, 2026 will be a critical year for Whitman. If he shows signs of improvement with his fastball, he‚Äôll be much, much higher on this list next year. And if he doesn‚Äôt, then he‚Äôll quickly turn into a forgotten draft pick in a long stretch of forgotten Giants draft picks. I would assume that he‚Äôll be back in Richmond for a second pass at AA this season, given his mediocre performance in 2025 and the bevy of arms lined up to start in AAA Sacramento. Keep your eye on him, folks ‚Ä¶ this is why following the Minor Leagues is so fun!

Now let‚Äôs add to the list, and we have some new names to choose from today! As a reminder, voting now takes place in the comment section using the ‚Äúrec‚Äù feature.

Note: Clicking on the above names will link to the CPL where they were voted onto the list.

Rayner Arias ‚Äî 19.8-year old OF ‚Äî .173 OPS/-42 wRC+ in Low-A (30 PA); .699 OPS/87 wRC+ in ACL (178 PA)

Carlos De La Rosa ‚Äî 18.1-year old LHP ‚Äî 4.73 ERA/2.30 FIP in DSL (32.1 IP)

Lisbel¬†Diaz¬†‚Äî 20.5-year old OF ‚Äî .725 OPS/96 wRC+ in Low-A (561 PA)

Trent¬†Harris¬†‚Äî 26.11-year old RHP ‚Äî 5.44 ERA/4.69 FIP in AAA (41.1 IP); 1.69 ERA/1.73 FIP in AA (16 IP)

Alberto Laroche ‚Äî 20.1-year old RHP ‚Äî 2.11 ERA/3.12 FIP in DSL (38.1 IP)

Joel Peguero ‚Äî 28.8-year old RHP ‚Äî 2.42 ERA/3.85 FIP in MLB (22.1 IP); 5.10 ERA/4.79 FIP in AAA (42.1 IP)

Diego¬†Velasquez¬†‚Äî 22.3-year old 2B ‚Äî .677 OPS/107 wRC+ in AA (566 PA)

Note: Each player‚Äôs first name links to their Baseball-Reference page, and their last name links to their Fangraphs page.¬†All stats are from the 2025 season.

title: The Dolphins hired a Packers‚Äô executive for GM. Is that good news for the Giants?
description: Does the Dolphins hiring the Packers VP of Player Personnel signal that the Giants are in the lead for John Harbaugh?
fullText:
The Miami Dolphins are hiring Green Bay Packers VP of Player Personnel Jon-Eric Sullivan as their next General Manager, per a report from Dianna Russini of The Athletic.

Sullivan, 50, has been a member of the Packers‚Äô front office since joining in 2003 as a training camp intern. He since ascended the organization‚Äôs ladder and was named the VP of Player Personnel in 2022. Russini adds that the Dolphins‚Äô philosophy is to hire their GM, then pursue a new head coach.

The obvious question is how this impacts the New York Giants‚Äô pursuit of Baltimore Ravens head coach John Harbaugh. It was widely expected that the Dolphins would hire Los Angeles Chargers assistant GM Chad Alexander, who has worked with both John and Jim Harbaugh.

The expected connection between Harbaugh and Alexander was considered to be a significant mark in Miami‚Äôs favor in swaying Harbaugh. It‚Äôs possible that Alexander doesn‚Äôt want to leave Los Angeles, or that Harbaugh does in fact favor the Giants. If we‚Äôre looking for personal connections, it‚Äôs possible that the Dolphins favor Mike McCarthy or Packers‚Äô DC Jeff Hafley ‚Äî or that their focus has shifted in that direction.

ESPN‚Äôs Jeff Darlington added some context to the reporting surrounding the Dolphins hiring Sullivan.

So how does this impact the potential hiring of John Harbaugh, you ask? The Dolphins remain interested, but I would not describe them as fixated. As I've been mentioning, the team believes in a structure that puts the GM in place first. The firing of McDaniel was never about the‚Ä¶ https://t.co/LDpEbTN25K

‚Äî Jeff Darlington (@JeffDarlington) January 9, 2026

In particular, there‚Äôs a definite shift in the tone used to describe Miami‚Äôs interest in Harbaugh. Where they were described as having a ‚Äúburning interest‚Äù in Harbaugh as recently as Thursday, they are now described as being ‚Äúinterested, but not fixated.‚Äù

Russini has also reported that the Giants have maintained open communications with Harbaugh‚Äôs camp in order to be as well prepared as possible for next week‚Äôs interview.

title: Heel hook machine Valter Walker to face Marcin Tybura at UFC Seattle
description: Will Valter Walker make it five heel hook finishes in a row in Seattle?
fullText:
The UFC's return to Seattle continues to take shape with the addition of a matchup between top 15 heavyweights Marcin Tybura and Valter Walker.

The UFC Fight Night event on March 28 takes place at Climate Pledge Arena in Seattle. Tybura (27-10 MMA, 14-9 UFC) and Walker (15-1 MMA, 4-1 UFC) confirmed the matchup on social media, although the promotion has yet to make an official announcement. The fight news was first reported by MMA Mania.

Tybura currently holds the No. 13 spot in the latest USA TODAY Sports/MMA Junkie heavyweight rankings, while Walker is among the honorable mentions.

In Tybura's first fight of 2026, he'll look to rebound from a first-round stoppage by the hands of Ante Delija in September. That result stopped the momentum of back-to-back wins over Jhonata Diniz and Mick Parkin.

Walker has been on a history-making tear since losing to Lukasz Brzeski in April 2024. He's won all four fights after that, all by heel hook. Junior Tafa, Don'Tale Mayes, Kennedy Nzechukwu and Louie Sutherland all tapped out to Walker's signature submission.

Marcin Tybura vs. Valter Walker

Mansur Abdul-Malik vs Yousri Belgaroui

title: Could Tom Brady be interested in fellow broadcaster?
description: Former star tight ends says he has had interest as head coach
fullText:
This week, former star tight end turned broadcaster Greg Olsen said he has fielded interest in coaching calls and he believes he could run a NFL team.

The interest shouldn‚Äôt be surprising. Olsen was a well-respected player known for his football intelligence and he is now highly regarded as a top broadcaster.

Greg Olsen says he‚Äôs fielded coaching calls, believes he could run an NFL team https://t.co/nrR26jHb4S pic.twitter.com/c2aGF7xLsb

‚Äî Awful Announcing (@awfulannouncing) January 7, 2026

Listen to Olsen call a game for a quarter and you know he‚Äôs not blowing smoke. He‚Äôs the knows the game.

So, NFL teams would be smart to pick his brain. And maybe that what Olsen‚Äôs FOX broadcasting teammate, Raiders part owner Tom Brady, will do. Brady, of course, along with Raiders‚Äô general manager John Spytek, is leading the search to replace the fired Pete Carroll.

Yes, the Raiders are looking at established coaches like, every team, but Brady has a work connection to Olsen.

It might as well be worth a call. Maybe it‚Äôs just as a n assistant coach position, or to stash away for the future.
